titles.title: To reauthorize the Atlantic Striped Bass Conservation Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries Conservation, Wildlife and Oceans.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-698.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 392.

action.text: Mr. Sherwood moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4408.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 393 - 12 (Roll no. 329).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

bill.summary: 6/26/2000--Passed House amended. Amends the Atlantic Striped Bass Conservation Act to authorize appropriations to carry out the Act.Directs the Secretaries of Commerce and the Interior to study and report to the Committee on Resources of the House of Representatives regarding whether the distribution of year classes in the Atlantic striped bass population is appropriate for maintaining adequate recruitment and sustainable fishing opportunities. Authorizes appropriations to the Secretary of Commerce to carry out this paragraph.
